title: Microsoft Corp. stock outperforms market on strong trading day
text:
Shares of Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       inched 0.29% higher to $375.79 Tuesday, on what proved to be an all-around grim trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        +0.11%
       falling 0.15% to 4,756.50 and Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       falling 0.42% to 37,525.16. This was the stock's second consecutive day of gains. Microsoft Corp. closed $8.51 below its 52-week high ($384.30), which the company achieved on November 29th. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Tuesday, as Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       fell 0.23% to $185.14, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 1.44% to $142.56, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 1.52% to $140.95. Trading volume (20.6 M) remained 5.6 million below its 50-day average volume of 26.2 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. The stock looks like a bet on Trump himself more than a company with significant revenue and profits.
